persistence
Class Broker<E extends Cachable>

java.lang.Object
  persistence.Broker<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer
Direct Known Subclasses:
EmployeeBroker
public abstract class Broker<E extends Cachable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer

All brokers should inherit this class. Includes database information for multiple db connectivity, BrokerThreads and associated methods for fetching results from the database and managing the threads.

Version:
0.2.0
Author:
dann, Daniel Wehr

Field Detail

db_username

private java.lang.String db_username
The database username that contains access to webagenda data

db_password

private java.lang.String db_password
Password for the user found in db_username that connects to the webagenda database

db_hostname

private java.lang.String db_hostname
Hostname where the webagenda database is located. This defaults to localhost.

int_threads

protected int int_threads
The max number of threads that the application should use to fetch resultsets from sqlstatements simultaneously. The method that calls issueStatement(SqlStatement) will then wait until their results are retrieved. That way, if one statement must call the db and the next has all data in cache, the cache can quickly retrieve it and the db can continue to fetch.

request_threads

private BrokerThread[] request_threads
The number of available threads that grab queue items and return data.

public Broker()
Method Detail

flushCache

public abstract int flushCache()
Flushes the Cache, writing all changes to the database that are 'dirty', have been changed from their original values.

Returns:
int error code
0: Successful Flush -1: Error (undefined)

clearCache

public abstract int clearCache()
Clears the Cache, flushing first and then uninitializing data that hasn't been used past the time specified.

Returns:
int error code 0: Successful Clear -1: Error (undefined)

cache

public abstract int cache(E cache_obj)
Place object in the Broker's memory. This will significatly reduce access time as Broker does not send a ThreadedConnection Request to the ConnectionManager which will access the database and return the value.

Parameters:
cache_obj -
Returns:

create

public abstract boolean create(E createObj)
Accepts a newly made object, and creates its equivalent record within the database. TODO An exception will be thrown if there is already a record in the database with the same primary key.

Parameters:
createObj - The object to add to the database.
Returns:
true if the create was successful, otherwise false.

get

public abstract E[] get(E getObj)
Retrieves data from the database and return them as objects.

Parameters:
getObj - A newly created object used to determine what will be returned. All non-null attributes will be used as search criteria. If the primary key is filled in the search object, only that will be used and all others will be ignored.
Returns:
All objects that matched the search criteria. If no matches are found, an array with a single null object will be returned.

update

public abstract boolean update(E updateObj)
Applies all changes to the updated object to its equivalent record within the database. The updated object must have originally been retrieved from the database. TODO An exception will be thrown if the record to be updated does not exist in the database.

Parameters:
updateObj - The previously retrieved object that has been updated.
Returns:
true if the update was successful, otherwise false.

delete

public abstract boolean delete(E deleteObj)
Removes the record from the database that is equivalent to the given object. The object to be deleted must have originally been retrieved from the database. TODO An exception will be thrown if the record to be deleted does not exist in the database.

Parameters:
deleteObj -
Returns:

issueStatement

public abstract void issueStatement(SqlStatement statement)
Issues a statement to the database from a Broker object. Depending on the application's configuration this method may cause ConnectionManager to throw the SingularThreadControlException, which will force the broker to issue the command in a thread, otherwise the ConnectionManager will issue it through the Singular Thread. The broker will use an applicable *Call object to perform statements that will be turned into an SqlStatement and sent. Each broker has its own *Call object it uses, with DbCall as its parent. The results are returned via an observable/observer pattern so the methods that retrieve results don't have to wait on other requests before getting their result.

Parameters:
statement - SqlStatement to send to database

nextFreeBrokerThread

public int nextFreeBrokerThread()
Method to return the next free space in the BrokerThread array.

Returns:
int next free position in BrokerThread array
Returns -1 if no free space is found.
